thread.title: Serena Williams withdraws from WTA Finals and China Open
thread.title_full: Serena Williams withdraws from WTA Finals and China Open

title: Serena Williams withdraws from WTA Finals and China Open
text:
Updated: 4:53 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015 | Posted: 4:53 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015 Serena Williams withdraws from WTA Finals and China Open ﻿   BEIJING — 
Serena Williams says she is withdrawing from the season-ending WTA Finals and the China Open to take time to heal after playing through injuries all year. 
Williams, who was two wins from completing a calendar-year Grand Slam at the U.S. Open, says she is "taking a proactive step and withdrawing from tournaments in Beijing and Singapore to properly address my health and take the time to heal." 
Williams was quoted in a story on the China Open website. 
In 2015, Williams won the Australian Open, the French Open and Wimbledon. But she missed out on becoming the first player since 1988 to win all four majors in the same season when she lost to Roberta Vinci in the U.S. Open semifinals. 
Maria Sharapova has also withdrawn from the China Open. Copyright   Sign up for our FOX23 News This Morning Newsletter Sign Up
